topics.body:
Hey guys, just dropping in, and also does basing a sci-fi fantasy fic in the US a good idea? I've got this story, well fanfic, in which Warcraft conflicts with the modern world and the US gets invaded by the Horde. 
And then after kicking the crap out of the Horde's invasion force, the US decides to invade Azeroth. :D 

So deploy the Marine Corps and kick Horde butt or just launch an expedition to see what the other side is like? I'm kind of unsure if this story would work, modern world vs fantasy. What do you guys think? 

Would the USMC be more than able to handle magic wielding creatures and fight dragons with M1A1s?
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fe62c66368722914f20000#post_53fe62c66368722914f20000

Depends on how Magic works on their side, where does it come from? Is it dependant on an item, the individual? How much can it be accessed by one at a time? Can it be used by others, if so, under which conditions?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fe633d6368727319400100#post_53fe633d6368727319400100

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fe6372636872072fbf0100#post_53fe6372636872072fbf0100

Well magic is limited to only Azeroth, our universe had no magic or any normal forms of energy they can tap into so they rely more on their own universe. The amount is limited, but they can become stronger, over time. 
Most average mages can summon basic elemental attacks, and a few more complicated ones, but they all take time to summon, and that can get them killed, they can also only do spells one at a time, so no multitasking. 

They have a few edges, being able to bring about magically summoned blizzards and such, but it can be haphazard to their allies as well, since a blizzard can effect everyone in proximity. 


I figured as much, since I've written quite a few stories, I just get side tracked though and lose interest, and kind of kills my great writing skills. I hate that when it happens, I get sloppy at the worst times.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fe65e36368726cd7cf0000#post_53fe65e36368726cd7cf0000

Oh no, we can't use magic, technically our bodies are out of synch with their universe, so we can't access magic. Not spontaneously, though if someone from our world is born there they might, if they are a child of a mage and regular person. Its possible.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

[bq="ParagonCommander"]"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fe64106368721a0d060000#post_53fe64106368721a0d060000
In the event Putin dies, what happens with the Russian government? Who would be next in line?[/bq]
That's probably how this shit is eventually going to end; the average lifespan of a person in russia is 70 years old and putin is 61.  He's in great shape right now, but he's starting to get old no matter how many shirtless pictures he poses for.  He's eventually going to be some old guy with a walker in government yelling at the young whippersnappers to turn down their music and complaining about youth today. . . okay he already does that, but you get the point.
